intro: Conyza stenodonta, commonly known as the narrowleaf horseweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. It has small, green leaves with a hairy texture and produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seeds. Conyza stenodonta is often considered a weed but has ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
